sect2.title: Lockdown
sect2.para: GNOME &version; allows system administrators to restrict certain functionality, so that users have a more controlled environment. This is particularly useful in very narrowly-defined work places, such as call centers, and in internet cafes.
For instance, the following features can be disabled by the system administrator: TODO: list stuff from panel, epiphany, nautilus

This can be configured by the system administrator with the gconf editor, and then distributed throughout the network.
